title: China launches three space missions, debuts new rocket configuration
summary: China launched three more space missions in recent weeks, debuting the country’s first rocket to be fitted with strap-on solid-fueled boosters and deploying satellites to image planet Earth and calibrate orbit prediction models, according to Chinese state media.

title: Space National Guard put on indefinite hold
summary: Instead of having a dedicated reserve force, the U.S. Space Force would have a regular active-duty force with full-time and part-time members, according to a proposal the Department of the Air Force submitted to Congress April 1.

title: Company that aims to race SpaceX to Mars plays with fire
summary: "We knew better as untrained college students."

title: SatixFy architect Yoel Gat dies amid SPAC merger plans
summary: Satellite communications equipment maker SatixFy said April 10 that cofounder and outgoing CEO Yoel Gat has died, days after announcing a leadership transition that would seat a new CEO in June amid plans to become a public company.

title: South Korea hires SpaceX to launch five spy satellites by 2025
summary: South Korea has signed a contract with SpaceX to launch five spy satellites by 2025, with the first launch on a Falcon 9 rocket by the end of 2023.
